How can I use the `getblocktemplate` command with Verus?

You can use the `getblocktemplate` command with Verus in two ways:
1. Directly from the command line: `verus getblocktemplate`
2. Using a tool like `curl` to send a JSON-RPC request: `curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblocktemplate", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/`

In both cases, the command will return a response that includes information about the next block to be mined.

mit" : n,          (numeric) limit of block size
 "curtime" : ttt,          (numeric) current timestamp in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)
 "bits" : "xxx",          (string) compressed target of next block
 "height" : n            (numeric) The height of the next block
}
```
Examples:
```bash
> verus getblocktemplate
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblocktemplate", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
